v.v: So these three men stopped answering Job because he was righteous in his own eyes.
Then was kindled the anger of Elihu son of Barakel the Buzite, of the family of Ram; it was kindled against Job because he justified himself rather than God.
Elihu’s anger was also kindled against his three friends because they had found no answer to Job, and yet they had condemned Job.
Now Elihu had waited to speak to Job because the other men were older than he.
However, when Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouths of these three men, his anger was kindled.
Then Elihu son of Barakel the Buzite spoke up and said,
I said, “Length of days should speak;
But there is a spirit in a man;
It is not only the great people who are wise,
Therefore I say to you, ‘Listen to me;
See, I waited for your words;
Indeed, I paid attention to you,
Be careful not to say, ‘We have found wisdom!’
For Job has not directed his words against me,
These three men are dumbfounded; they can answer Job no longer;
Should I wait because they are not speaking,
No, I also will answer on my part;
For I am full of words;
See, my breast is like fermenting wine that has no vent;
I will speak so that I may be refreshed;
I will not show favoritism;
For I do not know how to give such titles;

v: “I am young, and you are very old.
That is why I held back and did not dare to tell you my own opinion.
a multitude of years should teach wisdom.
the breath of the Almighty gives him understanding.
nor the aged people alone who understand justice.
I will also tell you my knowledge.’
I listened to your arguments
while you were thinking about what to say.
but, see, there was not one of you who could convince Job
or who could respond to his words.
God will have to defeat Job; mere man cannot do it.
so I will not answer him with your words.
they have not a word more to say.
because they stand there silent and answer no more?
I will also tell them my knowledge.
the spirit in me compels me.
like new wineskins, it is ready to burst.
I will open my lips and answer.
neither will I give honorific titles to any man.
if I did so, my Maker would soon take me away.
